page.title: Built-in List Control Editors in a Form View

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the Data Controls menu. Click on the [List] option to add a list control to the component.
In the properties list's List Properties section click the [...] button next to the 'List properties' property to open the List Builder.
On the List Builder's Data Source pane set the 'Data Source Type' to 'SQL'.
In the SQL Data Source section click the [...] button next to the 'Connection string' property. Set the connection string to the 'Northwind' database.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Table name' property and select the 'Customers' table.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Field list' property and select these fields: 'CustomerID', 'CompanyName', 'ContactName', 'City', and 'Country'.
Open the 'List Layout' pane. Use the blue > arrow to move the five data fields from the 'Available Fields' list into the 'Columns in List' section. Click OK to close the List Builder.

section.title: Add the FormView Control and EditorSet

step.description: On the UX Controls page highlight the list control. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and click on the [Form View] option to add a Form View control to the component.
Highlight the form view control in the tree. Open the 'Containers' menu and click on the [Container] option.
From the Container type list select the 'EditorSet' option and click 'Insert After'.
Highlight the EditorSet in the tree. Open the Defined Controls menu and select the 'Editor-List' option. Give this Editor the name 'EDITOR_LIST'.
Highlight the EditorSet in the tree. From the Defined Controls menu select the 'Editor-TextBox' option. Use the default name and click OK.
Highlight entire EditorSet and everything inside it. Open the 'Containers' menu and click on the [Container] option.
From the 'Container type' list select the 'None' option and click 'OK'

section.title: Adding to the Client-Side Data Cache

step.description: On the UX Controls page click locate the 'Menu' dropdown in the Controls page toolbar. Click on the 'Client-side Data Cache Editor' option.
Click on the 'Add item' button.
Name the new item 'cities' and click OK.
Highlight the cities item and click the 'Edit item' button.
From the Item type menu select the 'SQL Query' choice.
In the SQL Query section of the properties list that appears click the [...] button next to the 'Connection string' property. Set the connection string to 'Northwind'.
Click on the [...] button next to the 'Table name' property and select the 'Customers' table.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Field list' property and select the 'City' and 'Country' fields.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Order' property. Select the 'City' and 'Country' fields again.
Check the 'Distinct' checkbox and click OK.
Click the 'Add item' button.
Give the new item the name 'countries' and click OK.
Highlight the 'countries' item and click the 'Edit item' button.
In the 'Edit Client-side Data Item' select the 'SQL Query' option.
In the SQL Query section of the properties list click the [...] button next to the 'Connection string' property. Create a connection string to the 'Northwind' database.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Table name' property and select the 'Customers' table.
Hit the [...] button next to the 'Field list' property and select the 'Country' field.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Filter' property.
Define the following filter and click OK.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Order' property and select the 'Country' field.
Check the checkbox next to the 'Distinct' property and click OK to close the 'Edit Client-side Data Item' dialog.
Click OK again to close the Client-side Data Cache Editor.
On the UX Controls page highlight the Form View control in the control tree.
In the properties list on the right click the [...] button next to the 'Form properties' property in the Form Properties section. The Form View Builder should open.
On the Form View Builder's Data Source pane. Set the 'Datasource type' to 'List'.
Click the [...] button next to the 'List name' property and select the list control 'list1'. Click OK.
Open the 'Form Layout' pane and click the 'Add item' button.
In the 'Select Control Type' dialog's Category menu select 'Data Controls'. In the Control menu select the [Label] option. Highlight all of the data fields in the list on the right and click OK.
Click the 'Add item' button again.
In the 'Category' menu select 'Pre-defined Controls' option. From the 'Control' menu select [Save Form Edits/ Cancel Edits Button] option and click OK.
Open the Fields pane. Highlight the 'CUSTOMERID' field in the 'Fields in Data Source' menu.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Editor set' property in the 'Editing' section of the properties list.
In the 'Select Editor' dialog select the 'EDITORSET_1' in the 'Editor Set' list and 'EDITOR_2' in the Editor list. Click the 'Assign selection to multiple fields' button.
Highlight the 'CustomerID', 'CompanyName', and 'ContactName' fields and click OK.
Highlight the 'City' field in the 'Fields in Data Source' list. Click the [...] button next to the 'Editor set' property.
In the Select Editor choose the 'EDITORSET_1' option in the 'Editor Set' list. In the 'Editor' list select the 'EDITOR_LIST' option. Click the 'Assign selection to multiple fields' button.
Highlight the 'City' and 'Country' options and click OK.
In the 'Fields in Data Source' menu highlight the 'City' field. In the properties list on the right click the [...] button next to the 'Editor configuration genie' property.
In the 'Form View Editor Configuration Genie' check the 'Show List column title(s)' property checkbox.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Customize Titles' property.
Add the following code to the Custom Titles dialog and click OK:
Set the 'List data source' property dropdown to 'Client-side Data Cache'.
